Okay as VT said about the file...

NOD32: a variant of Win32/Packed.VMProtect.AAD

This means it's compiled/packed with VMProtect. VMProtect is a file compiler which is used to compile a bunch of files or one .vbs file into one single file. The reason NOD32 added this is that the cracked version of VMProtect downloads malicious things without your permission/knowledge. I can't think of it, but I think this file is safe. Just try it.

UPDATE:

Tried it out, seems to be fine and doesn't add more files than other, but what I'm confused is where is the key. Other problems that seemed to appear that HP seems to load longer than expected, but it still runs. Somehow if you Alt+Tab your game will epicly slow down. Oh wait, that's just my PC.

K, the file is clean - no serious virus here.
